user_sentiment: cautiously satisfied but uncertain - the fix appears to work but raises questions about correctness and design
execution_quality: The agent executed the fix efficiently but appears to have applied a solution without fully understanding or documenting the source of the headers and their proper precedence hierarchy.
work_category: Bug fix implementation in an agent communication system, modifying header precedence logic for merchant proxy requests.
summary: The agent made a targeted edit that resolved the immediate issue, but the follow-up question indicates the user needs clarification about the design decisions behind the fix. The agent may have applied a band-aid solution without fully understanding the architectural implications of header precedence in the system. Further iteration is needed to ensure the fix is not just functionally correct but also architecturally sound.
follow_up_pattern: User is asking clarifying questions about the fix to gain understanding before accepting it as correct; expects agent to explain the header origins and provide design rationale.
